https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.short_instructions: Add a second `move forward` block to reach the sheep.
https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.long_instructions: Add a second `move forward` block to reach the sheep.

authored_hints.mc_1_a: The `move forward` block is at the top of the toolbox.
authored_hints.mc_1_b: Make sure both `move forward` blocks are snapped to the `when run` block.

callouts.craft_drag_block_callout: Drag a "move forward" block and snap it below the other block

https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.short_instructions: Wood is a very important resource. Many things are made from it. Walk to the tree and use the “destroy block” command to chop it down.
https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.long_instructions: Wood is a very important resource. Many things are made from it. Walk to the tree and use the `destroy` block command to chop it down.

authored_hints.mc_2_a: You need to `move forward` twice to stand in front of the tree.
authored_hints.mc_2_b: The `destroy block` command cuts down the tree in front of you.

https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.short_instructions: Sheep-shearing time! Use the “shear” command to gather wool from both sheep.
https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.long_instructions: Sheep-shearing time! Use the `shear` command to gather wool from both sheep.

authored_hints.mc_3_a: The `shear` block gets the sheep in front of you. Are you facing the sheep?
authored_hints.mc_3_b: If you need to change the way you are facing, use a `turn` block.
authored_hints.mc_3_c: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Run the code to see what happens, even if you haven't solved the puzzle yet.

https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.short_instructions: We need to build a house before the sun goes down. Houses require a lot of wood. Cut down all 3 trees.

authored_hints.mc_4_a: You can chop down trees in any order. What path takes the smallest number of blocks?
authored_hints.mc_4_b: The `destroy block` command cuts down the tree in front of you.

callouts.craft_callout_preplaced: We've put some blocks here to get you started

https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.short_instructions: Every house starts with a wall. Build the first part of your house by putting the "place" and "move forward" commands inside the repeat loop.
https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.long_instructions: Every house starts with a wall. Build the first part of your house by putting the `place` and `move forward` commands inside the repeat loop.

authored_hints.mc_5_a: Use the `place` block first, and then the `move` block.
authored_hints.mc_5_b: Make sure both blocks are inside of the `repeat` loop to run the code more than once.
authored_hints.mc_5_c: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Run the code to see what happens, even if you haven't solved the puzzle yet.

callouts.craft_inside_repeat: Repeat actions by placing blocks in here

https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.short_instructions: Build the rest of your house from any material you'd like. The "repeat" command will come in handy.
https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.long_instructions: Build the rest of your house from any material you'd like. The `repeat` command will come in handy.

authored_hints.mc_6_a: Click the arrow on the `place` block to choose what you want to place.
authored_hints.mc_6_b: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Run the code to see what happens, even if you haven't solved the puzzle yet.
authored_hints.mc_6_c: You can put more than one block inside of a `repeat` loop.

callouts.craft_callout_preplaced_house: This code will start building your house. Can you finish it?

https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.short_instructions: It’s good to plan ahead. Plant crops on both sides of the water so you don’t get hungry later on.

authored_hints.mc_7_a: Use the `plant crop` block to plant a crop in the space where you are standing.
authored_hints.mc_7_b: Both stripes of dark brown land by the water need to be filled with crops.
authored_hints.mc_7_c: You can put more than one block inside of a `repeat` loop.

https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.short_instructions: Running into a Creeper is a bad idea. Carefully move past the Creepers and reach the safety of your home.

authored_hints.mc_8_a: There are a few paths you can take. Which is the shortest?
authored_hints.mc_8_b: Use `repeat` loops to simplify your code.
authored_hints.mc_8_c: Your goal is to get into the doorway of the house at the top of the screen.

https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.short_instructions: You’ll find the most valuable resources underground, but it can get dark. Place at least 2 torches and mine at least 2 coal.

authored_hints.mc_9_a: Are you facing the right way? The `destroy block` mines the block in front of you.
authored_hints.mc_9_b: The black specks in the wall are coal! Use `destroy block` on these to mine the coal.
authored_hints.mc_9_c: Use `place torch` to put a torch in the space where you are standing.

https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.short_instructions: Walking into molten lava is a bad idea. Place cobblestone to create a bridge, then mine at least two of the iron blocks.

authored_hints.mc_10_a: The iron blocks are the speckled spaces behind the torch! How are you going to get over there?
authored_hints.mc_10_b: When you are standing at the edge of the lava, use `place cobblestone ahead` to make a safe path. Then, you can walk over it!
authored_hints.mc_10_c: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Run the code to see what happens, even if you haven't solved the puzzle yet.

https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.short_instructions: Lava is hiding beneath some of these blocks, which you'll need to cover up before moving forward. An "if" command will come in handy here. Add a "move forward" command in the correct place to mine these blocks.
https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.long_instructions: Lava is hiding beneath some of these blocks, which you'll need to cover up before moving forward. An `if` command will come in handy here. Add a `move forward` command in the correct place to mine these blocks.

authored_hints.mc_11_a: All of the code is in place to check for lava and deal with it. All you need to do is add a block to move.
authored_hints.mc_11_b: Should your `move forward` command go inside of the `if` statement or after?

callouts.craft_callout_moveforward: This code will check for lava, can you add a command to move forward?

https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.short_instructions: Now things are getting tricky. Mine 3 redstone, but don’t fall in the lava. Use an "If" command to place cobblestone over any lava you uncover.
https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.long_instructions: Now things are getting tricky. Mine 3 redstone, but don’t fall in the lava. Use an `if` command to place cobblestone over any lava you uncover.

authored_hints.mc_12_a: The spaces with red speckles are where you will find Redstone.
authored_hints.mc_12_b: Can you use a `repeat` loop to make your code shorter?
authored_hints.mc_12_c: Use an `if` statement to check spaces for lava, then place cobblestones.

https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.short_instructions: Great job! You’ve gathered lots of resources and built a modest home. Now lay rail from the edge of the map to the door of your house.

authored_hints.mc_13_a: Use `place rail` to lay rail on the square you are standing in.
authored_hints.mc_13_b: Use `repeat` loops to make your code shorter.

https://studio.code.org/s/mc/lessons/1/l.short_instructions: Congratulations! You've completed all our puzzles! Now mine, build, and create something unique by using everything you've learned so far.
